title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When performing the steps to reproduce, it takes 8 seconds to close the file, answer 'no' to the save changes dialog, and reopen the file by double-clicking on it in the navigator. However, if the 'Revert' option is selected from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: This seems odd, since reverting the file contents ought not be more time-consuming than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1) Start by opening an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open-source repository.
2) Select the end of the first line and insert a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) To reproduce, perform the following steps:
   a) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
   b) Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
   c) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.

Alternatively:
1) Repeat steps 1) and 2) above to mark the file as dirty.
2) Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor to replace the contents of the window with the original.
